page.title: 13THE LAST GREAT WILDERNESS?
page.content: People came to Assynt & Lochinver because they were "cleared" by their Landlords to make way for sheep. These people built shops first. The first house in Lochinver is now the Doctor's surgery. Culag House (now a Hotel) was built by the Duke of Sutherland in 1870. It was rebuilt after a fire in 1929 by the Vesty family. The Church is unique because it was dismantled & bought stone by stone by boat from Nairn, & rebuilt in Lochinver. It is being re-roofed this year. Assynt & Lochinver is more famous for it's wild & rugged landscape. Famous mountains like Suilven, Canisp, Quinag, & Stac Polleidh, can all be viewed to advantage from here. Our area has been described as "the last great widerness in Europe", a description that cannot be bettered.
